case_data.name: United States of America v. Garland Independent School District

documents.title: Order [Regarding Joint Status Report]
documents.text:
Case 3:70-cv-04100-K   Document 13   Filed 09/16/08    Page 1 of 1   PageID 545
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT
FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF TEXAS
DALLAS DIVISION
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, §
§
Plaintiff, §
§ CIVIL ACTION NO.
v. §
§ 3:70-CV-4100-K
GARLAND INDEPENDENT SCHOOL §
DISTRICT §
§
Defendant. §
ORDER
Before the Court is Parties’ Joint Status Report, filed on September 12, 2008.  As
contained in the Joint Status Report, the Court will continue monitoring the District
under the terms of the July 14, 1987 Agreed Judgment, as requested by the parties.  
In the event the parties can come to an agreement that reduces the number of
quarterly reports filed with the Court, they are directed to file an agreed motion and
proposed order with the Court.    
SO ORDERED.
DATED: September 16th, 2008.
________________________________
ED KINKEADE
UNITED STATES DISTRICT JUDGE

documents.title: Quarterly Report
documents.text:
Case 3:70-cv-04100-K   Document 33   Filed 06/18/13    Page 1 of 6   PageID 2431
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT 
FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF TEXAS 
DALLAS DIVISION 
§ 
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA  §  CIVIL ACTION 
§ 
VS.  § 
§  NO. 3:70-cv-04100-K 
GARLAND INDEPENDENT  § 
SCHOOL DISTRICT  § 
QUARTERLY REPORT 
TO JUDGE ED KINKEADE 
June 15,2013 
GARLAND INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DISTRICT 
Dr. Bob Morrison, Superintendent 

Case 3:70-cv-04100-K   Document 33   Filed 06/18/13    Page 2 of 6   PageID 2432
Garland Independent School District 
Office of Superintendent 
Street Address 
Harris Hill Administration Building 
501 S. Jupiter Rd. 
Garland, TX 
75042 
Phone 
972·487-3023 
FAX 
972-485-4936 
June 15, 2013 
The Honorable Ed Kinkeade, Judge 
United States District Court for the 
Northern District of Texas, Dallas Division 
1100 Commerce Street, Room #15E6 
Dallas, Texas  75242 
RE:  The United States of America, et al 
v. Garland Independent School 
District, No. CA3-4100R 
Dear Judge Kinkeade: 
Pursuant to the order in the Agreed Judgment of July 14, 1987, please accept this letter and 
accompanying exhibits as the Garland Independent School District's June semi-annual 
report on the status of the Freedom of Choice Plan (with Court-ordered Modifications, as 
Amended in 1987).  The report will be reviewed by the local Board of Trustees on June 25, 
2013, and by the Multi-Ethnic Committee at their first meeting in August. 
The points enumerated below describe current conditions and developments since the last 
report of December 15, 2012.  The narrative portion of the report continues to be 
abbreviated and the accompanying exhibits provide corroborative and supplemental data. 
Major occurrences since December 15, 2012, are as follows: 
1.  The school year ended at the three elementary academies (Kimberlin, Hillside, 
and Walnut Glen), the four math-science-technology centers (Watson, Beaver, 
Jackson, and North Garland), the middle school academy (Austin), the Classical 
Centers (Vial and Brandenburg), and the magnet programs at Garland and 
Lakeview Centennial High Schools with only minor changes in enrollment and 
ethnic percentages since the December 15 report. 
See Exhibit 1. 
Diverse Community·.  Shored Vision.  Exceptionol Educa/ion 

Case 3:70-cv-04100-K   Document 33   Filed 06/18/13    Page 3 of 6   PageID 2433
Judge Ed Kinkeade 
Page 2 
June 15, 2013 
2.  The annual thirty-day Freedom of Choice period for secondary campuses ended 
on February 22, 2013, and the annual thirty-day Freedom of Choice period for 
elementary campuses ended on April 1, 2013.  This is the time parents selected 
the school(s) they wish their children to attend in 2013-14.  With reference to 
Austin, Hillside, Kimberlin, Walnut Glen, Beaver, Watson, Jackson MST, North 
Garland MST, the Classical Centers at Vial and Brandenburg, and the magnet 
programs at GHS and LCHS, it was then important to screen applicants for these 
schools and fill spaces.  Based on the screening exercise at the other campuses, 
the following figures are pertinent: 
a.  Hillside currently has 329 gifted/talented students enrolled for the fall. 
Included are 38 Kindergartners, 41 first graders, 61 second graders, 66 third 
graders, 60 fourth graders, and 63 fifth graders.  Of this total number, 96 
(29.18%) will be White; 30 (9.12%) will be Black; 59 (17.93%) will be Asian; 3 
(0.91%) will be American Indian; 129 (39.21%) will be Hispanic; and 12 
(3.65%) will be two or more races or ethnicities. 
b.  Kimberlin currently has 336 gifted/talented students enrolled for the fall. 
Included are 33 Kindergartners, 65 first graders, 64 second graders, 54 third 
graders, 55 fourth graders, and 65 fifth graders.  Of this total number, 136 
(40.48%) will be White; 47 (13.99%) will be Black; 30 (8.93%) will be Asian; 3 
(0.89%) will be American Indian; 106 (31.55%) will be Hispanic; and 14 
(4.17%) will be two or more races or ethnicities. 
c.  Walnut Glen currently has 359 gifted/talented students enrolled for the fall. 
Included are 33 Kindergarteners, 57 first graders, 64 second graders, 66 third 
graders, 68 fourth graders, and 71 fifth graders.  Of this total number, 103 
(28.69%) will be White; 13 (3.62%) will be Black; 64 (17.83%) will be Asian; 5 
(1.39%) will be American Indian; 161 (44.85%) will be Hispanic; and 13 
(3.62%) will be two or more races or ethnicities. 
d.  Beaver Technology Center for Math and Science currently has 322 MST 
students enrolled for the fall.  Included are 33 Kindergarteners, 38 first 
graders, 62 second graders, 71 third graders, 57 fourth graders, and 61 fifth 
graders.  Of this number, 92 (28.57%) will be White; 39 (12.11 %) will be Black; 
82 (25.47%) will be Asian; 102 (31.68%) will be Hispanic; 1 (0.31 %) will be 
Pacific Islander; and 5 (1.55%) will be two or more races or ethnicities. 
e.  Watson Technology Center for Math and Science currently has 346 MST 
students enrolled for the fall.  Included are 33 Kindergarteners, 45 first 
graders, 70 second graders, 70 third graders, 59 fourth graders, and 69 fifth 
graders.  Of this number, 104 (30.06%) will be White; 66 (19.08%) will be 
Black; 50 (14.45%) will be Asian; 1 (0.29%) will be American Indian; 119 
(34.39%) will be Hispanic; and 5 (1.45%) will be two or more races or 
ethnicities. 

Case 3:70-cv-04100-K   Document 33   Filed 06/18/13    Page 4 of 6   PageID 2434
Judge Ed Kinkeade 
Page 3 
June 15, 2013 
f.  Austin currently has 681 gifted/talented students enrolled for the fall.  Included 
are 220 sixth graders, 233 seventh graders, and 228 eighth graders.  Of this 
total number, 246 (36.12%) will be White; 77 (11.31%) will be Black; 122 
(17.91 %) will be Asian; 4 (0.59%) will be American Indian; 209 (30.69%) will 
be Hispanic; and 23 (3.38%) will be two or more races or ethnicities. 
g.  Garland High School's IB Program has 537 students enrolled in the fall. 
Included are 178 tenth graders, 182 eleventh graders, and 177 twelfth 
graders.  Of this total number, 199 (37.06%) will be White; 1 (0.19%) will be 
Pacific Islander; 61  (11.36%) will be Black; 112 (20.86%) will be Asian; 3 
(0.56%) will be American Indian; 150 (27.93%) will be Hispanic; and 11 
(2.05%) will be two or more races or ethnicities. 
h.  At Jackson Middle School, there are currently 636 students enrolled in the 
MST component for the fall.  Included will be 230 sixth graders, 218 seventh 
graders, and 188 eighth graders.  Of this total number, 193 (30.35%) will be 
White; 94 (14.78%) will be Black; 112 (17.61 %) will be Asian; 4 (0.63%) will be 
American Indian; 219 (34.43%) will be Hispanic; and 17 (2.20%) will be two or 
more races or ethnicities. 
i.  At North Garland High School, there are currently 762 stUdents enrolled in the 
MST component for the fall.  Included will be 236 ninth graders, 185 tenth 
graders, 169 eleventh graders, and 172 twelfth graders.  Of this number, 122 
(16.01%) will be White; 120 (15.75%) will be Black; 229 (30.05%) will be 
Asian; 7 (0.92%) will be American Indian; 273 (35.83%) will be Hispanic; and 
11 (1.44%) will be two or more races or ethnicities. 
j.  At The Classical Center at Vial Elementary School, there are currently 420 
magnet students enrolled for the fall.  Included will be 55 Kindergarteners, 69 
first graders; 81  second graders, 85 third graders, 65 fourth graders, and 65 
fifth graders. Of this number, 127 (30.24%) will be White; 1 (0.24%) will be 
Pacific Islander; 74 (17.62%) will be Black; 31  (7.38%) will be Asian; 2 (0.48%) 
will be American Indian; 178 (42.38%) will be Hispanic; and 7 (1.67%) will be 
two or more races or ethnicities.  (The Dual Language Bilingual program was 
added to this campus in 2010-11 for kindergarten students, first grade was 
added in 2011-12, and second grade was added in 2012-2013.  Next year, the 
program will be grown to third grade and continue each year until it reaches 
grade 5 in the fall of 2015.) 
k.  At The Classical Center at Brandenburg Middle School, there are currently 
740 magnet students enrolled for the fall.  Included will be 260 sixth graders, 
241 seventh graders, and 239 eighth graders.  Of the total number, 310 
(41.89%) will be White; 108 (14.59%) will be Black; 54 (7.30%) will be Asian; 1 
(0.14%) will be American Indian; 247 (33.38%) will be Hispanic; and 20 
(2.70%) will be two or more races or ethnicities. 

Case 3:70-cv-04100-K   Document 33   Filed 06/18/13    Page 5 of 6   PageID 2435
Judge Ed Kinkeade 
Page 4 
June 15, 2013 
I.  Lakeview Centennial High School's College-Career-Connect component has 
1,185 students enrolled in the fall.  Included are 289 ninth graders, 288 tenth 
graders, 281 eleventh graders, and 327 twelfth graders.  Of this total number, 
335 (28.27%) will be White; 298 (25.15%) will be Black; 63 (5.32%) will be 
Asian; 8 (0.68%) will be American Indian; 460 (38.82%) will be Hispanic; and 
21  (1.77%) will be two or more races or ethnicities. 
See Exhibit 2. 
3.  After the thirty-day Freedom of Choice ended, it became necessary to mail letters 
to parents of 1,419, students asking them to make a second choice of school. 
(This figure compares with 1,771 a year ago.)  These letters went to parents at 44 
elementary schools (577 students), 12 middle schools (512 students), and 7 high 
schools (330 students). 
See Exhibit 3. 
4.  At the present time, enrollment restrictions have been put in place at all 
elementary schools, 9 middle schools, and 4 high schools.  After the 2013-14 
choice of school results, the district has no schools below the Anglo standard of 
the ethnic band.  Two schools are above the Anglo standard of the ethnic band 
after our 2013-14 choice process.  These schools are Armstrong Elementary 
School (45.9%) and Keeley Elementary School (58.9%).  Students seeking 
enrollment at a closed school are placed on a waiting list if the parents so request. 
Many of them will ultimately be accepted when other students fail to show up 
when school starts. 
See Exhibits 4 and 5. 
5.  Current pre-enrollment figures at each school indicate an Anglo range of 2.5% 
(Bullock) at the low end to 58.9% (Keeley). 
See Exhibit 5. 
6.  Transportation costs associated with the Court Order are estimated at 
$5,723,279.00 for 2012-13 and $5,960,194.00 in 2013-14. 
See Exhibit 6. 
7.  The Personnel Department recruited at six predominantly Black colleges in 
Texas, three predominantly Black out-of-state universities, and five predominantly 
Hispanic institutions during the 2012-2013 school year. 
See Exhibit 7. 

Case 3:70-cv-04100-K   Document 33   Filed 06/18/13    Page 6 of 6   PageID 2436
Judge Ed Kinkeade 
Page 5 
June 15, 2013 
8.  The District is in compliance with the Court directive to solicit scholarships for 
minority students.  In May 2013,964 scholarships were awarded to minority 
students at a total value of $14,215,541. 
See Exhibit 8. 
Respectfully submitted, 
~or~~~ 
BM/jm 
Copy:  Robert E. Luna, Attorney-at-Law for the Garland I.S.D. 
Edward B. Cloutman, Attorney-at-Law for the Garland N.AAC.P. 
Jeremiah Glassman, Attorney-at-Law for the U.S. Dept. of Justice 
Toni Hunter, Attorney General's Office for the State of Texas 
School Trustees 
Multi-Ethnic Committee Members 
GISD Assistant Superintendents 
Garland Branch N.AAC.P.
